intro: Celtica gigantea subsp. gigantea, commonly known as the giant celtica, is a tall, herbaceous plant native to specific regions of Europe. It features large, lance-shaped leaves that are typically dark green and have a slightly hairy texture. The plant produces showy, white or pale pink flowers arranged in dense clusters during the summer months. It thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils and is often found near water bodies. Due to its size and striking appearance, it is a notable species in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
